newsitem.title: USA: Intel warns of below-expected results.
newsitem.headline: Intel warns of below-expected results.

text.p: Intel Corp. , the leading maker of computer chips and a technology bellwether, said Friday that revenues and net income for its fiscal second quarter will fall below expectations due to weaker-than-projected demand, particularly in Europe.

Revenue for the period is expected to drop 5 to 10 percent below the first quarter's $6.4 billion, while gross margin, a key measure of profitability, is forecast at under the 64 percent of the prior period, Intel said.
The news took Wall Street by surprise and weighed heavily on Intel shares in third-market trading before the Nasdaq market opened.
Intel's stock tumbled to $145.50 from $163.766 in frenzied pre-opening activity, traders said.
At least one brokerage house weighed in with an immediate downgrade. Morgan Stanley cut its rating to outperform from strong buy.
Traders said the Intel news sapped investor confidence in other leading technology shares. Microsoft fell to $123 from $125.875 and Dell Computer was at $107 from $110.375.
According to First Call, $2.16 per share is the consensus of 35 analyst earnings forecasts for the second quarter ending in June.

Intel also said second-quarter expenses are expected to be 7 to 9 percent above the $1.3 billion it recorded in the prior quarter, and second-quarter interest and other income is forecast at $170 million.

For the full year, research and development spending is projected at $2.4 billion, the tax rate for the year is expected to be unchanged at 35.5 percent and capital spending is put at $4.5 billion, Intel said.
